data.text: You sit upright on the bench and hold your breath to better listen for the clicking. It's unsettlingly sharp, each click piercing like a gunshot across the sand. Directionality is hard to pick out at first, but it quickly becomes clear there are clicks from multiple directions - and they're very quickly approaching.

Before you can decide to run for the train - or really do much besides just stand up - the things are upon you. Clouds of onrushing blackness, dull reflections of moonlight on what could be blades or claws, and a dark, deep orange-red glow.
